intro: Eschscholzia delitescens, commonly known as the golden poppy, is a species native to California, belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. The flowers are cup-shaped with five petals and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
